title: I'm disappointed- No, FURIOUS, at these Lunar Even bundles
body:
Here's the thing: **Everything in the Lunar Event is practically behind a bundle wall or pay  X amount of money to obtain everything you want.** Seriously, look at it. 

* Puppy Warwick Icon locked behind bundle for 1250 with Gemstone. Basically pay 1000 extra RP for the icon and get one free gemstone. Worthless to anyone who already has multiple gemstones and all the gem skins or doesn't want any gem skins.

* Puppy Nasus Icon locked behind bundle for golden token for gold chroma if you want for 540. Easy outlet to gather one of those chromas and the icon for their combined prices (except if you just want the icon)

* Puppy Nasus/Warwick Wards behind bundle exclusively for extra orbs and tokens. Granted, doing the math, it does save you money (640 ward, 750 (revel orb & 4 tokens 250 x3), 290 for golden chroma token from before = 1680 for price of 1500) but still if you don't want the bundle, you shouldn't be forced to buy it if you just want the ward.

And now lets get into something a bit more contriversal: the loading borders and new Lunar chromas:

* Loading borders either are 64 tokens, so only one if you go through the missions and don't want to save for gold chroma, or **an extra 425 if you buy the base bundle, which they're only available in!**. WHY!?!?! Didn't we already have this issue in the last Star Guardian event about buying the loading borders and through bundles? Did Riot seriously not learn from that? We got all three loading borders from last PROJECT event, why not make it the same here?

* Red chroma for skins exclusive through bundle + extra 425 for loading border as before if you want to grab all of that together. Why make one particular chroma only exclusive through a god damn bundle but only for a limited time? Why start implementing this rule of marketing now? What is this, SMITE?


And once again, you can only gain 96 total from all the mission in this, so you can only get one loading border or chroma from token technically for free. So it all comes down to:

- Want rest of chromas, buy orbs + bundles to get them and either use regular tokens to upgrade to golden or get lucking in the orbs. 
- Want rest of loading borders, buy orbs and/or bundles to get them.

While we're at it, let's look over the prices of these bundles and whatnot with the [calculator](http://rptousd.com/) of nearest pricing:

- Puppy Ward bundles (1500 RP = $10.71, $21.42 for both)
- Nasus Puppy Icon (540 RP = $4.15)
- Warwick Puppy Icon (1250 RP = $9.06)
- Legendary Loot Bundle (5500 RP = $38.19)
- Base Lunar Bundles with Skin and Border (1775 RP = $12.68, $38.04 for all three)
- Year of the Dog Bundle (4686 RP = $32.80)
- Chroma bundles w/o loading border ( 2225 RP (Nasus & WW) = $15.89, $31.78 for both, 2420 RP (Lux) = $17.29, $49.07 total)
- Chroma bundles with loading border ( 2650 RP (Nasus & WW) = $18.93, $37.85 for both,  2845 RP (Lux) = $19.91, $57.77 total)

So if we wanted to get the new Lux, Nasus and WW skins (which we will count as already having the champs) with borders (while saving tokens we gain from missions for one gold chroma) and also want all the other chromas, we would roughly need to buy 8145 RP, which as calculated is roughly around $57.77 dollars, or buy the year of the dog bundle at 4686 ($32.80) and then buy all the regular chromas, which would roughly be around 2830 RP or $19.81 for a grand total of $52.61 (might be a bit wrong in my math so don't come beating my head around saying I was wrong in prices). 

**But that's just if we're wanting the new skins, borders and chromas with them. **If we also want the icons, or wards, we need to drop another $34.63 worth of RP on top of the $52.61. And if you want the other gold chromas, well then I'm going to wish you luck on that because the orbs will more than likely drop random amounts or random chances of gold tokens and who knows what the statistics of those are. 

I'm severely disappointed in Riot. I am. I thought that they learned their lesson of having borders being bought rather than gaining them for free and keep them out of bundles only. I thought they learned this with the last PROJECT event. And worst off, with how the game is right now, being nearly un-enjoyable to play for many/most, them being greedy with this event is really put more of a dent of my respect for them even more now. I'm almost ashamed to be hanging on to this game if they're going to try this while the game is at (arguably) the worst it's been now.

And I really don't want to spend money to them to continue supporting this kind of marketing behavior, whether or not the game is in a terrible state.

Because there is difference between organizing chocolate you have to produce for each packet and creating a digital skin (you know If they'd make package of 5 pieces of the same skin they just copy-paste the data, they do not manufacture anything extra) and not putting it into one bundle in the database.

If you have package of 10 pieces of 5 flavours (2 per flavour) and 5 packages of 10 pieces of same flavour (10 per flavour in each package), it's much more difficult to organize than creating 3 champ skins and 2 ward skins as digital content and distributing them by programming a button to send transaction which substracts certain amount of RP and unlocks the one specific item.

Also there is difference between physical packagae distribution and digital data distribution.

The comparsion is simply totally irrelevant.

It's not irrelevant because a company is still making a choice about how it wants to present products to it's consumers. The chocolate company chooses to sell it's flavors as a set, just in the same way that Riot chooses to sell its _ART_ in a set. Riot is manufacturing something (art, programming, digital content) and then choosing how to sell it. They run statistics after their events and things to figure out what sells and what doesn't sell - that's how businesses operate. If they've learned that from the past 3 events that solo ward skins don't sell as well as ward skins in a bundle with other things, what does that tell them as a company? It tells them that they will make MORE money if they bundle ward skins, because their data is telling them that people are willing to spend more money on a bundle than they are to spend a little money on a single item. So even if you, or this very loud collective are screaming that "RIOT IS GREEDY! RIOT DOESN'T SELL ME WHAT I WANT HOW I WANT IT!," their data might show a completely contrary story, and there will probably be people who might not want to buy a ward skin by itself as compared to buying it in a bundle (you'll have to spend at least $10 to buy a ward skin since it's over the $5 RP quantity, but the marketing caveat there is that you could probably be willing to spend that entire $10 on a bundle with the ward skin if it landed you extra stuff at a deal since you're having to spend $10 anyway). Your views as a consumer are just that - as _A_ consumer, and not as the buying population of League of Legends as a whole. They have the data they need to determine how their products will sell better, and sometimes it might not appeal to everyone, but will probably appeal to more people in general.

I want to some things I'm seeing in this thread and (IMO) why OP's criticisms of the way Riot is selling these skins is valid:

>Point: "You don't have to spend money, it's cosmetic."

Counterpoint: Despite this, OP could very well want to get some of these things and give Riot money. This isn't abount "don't spend money if you don't want it" but rather "you should accept whatever deal you're given." In addition, Riot has made much of these things exclusive and time-based. While the skins will come back, there's no telling if the chroma or the icons will come back. OP might be backed into a corner and forced to get something he'd want now, even if it's in a deal he doesn't want, because nobody knows if he can get it at a later date.

>Point: "Just don't buy everything you see."

Counterpoint: Certain things come in certain bundles. This means that even if he just wants two icons he has to spend far more than he would just to get all of them. Same goes for the exclusive chromas: If he wants the red one, he has to buy the specific bundle. This is again not an argument about **wanting to get everything with a bundle** but rather **wanting to get a specific thing but having to buy the bundle.**

>Point: "Riot is a company and has to make sales."

Counterpoint: They can do so in a more consumer-friendly way. While I think they're both scummy, there's a huge difference between Overwatch loot boxes and Battlefront 2's loot boxes which color peoples opinions on them. Plus, despite the mission system, OP has to sink money in. You can love League and even Riot but hitting a paywall is never fun.


All that said, I'm in somewhat agreement with OP. While I get that Riot wants to make/offer exclusive content with bundles, it's something Riot should let players customize to a degree. It would encourage more sales and you never feel like you're getting stuff you don't want, as you can tweak and purchase content in a way that fits your desires. Sorry you can't get everything you want though, I know that feeling of the grind.

First of all everyone brings this up on the boards as a counter argument and it's a total non-sequitur; just because League is the highest grossing F2P game in the world, you have NO IDEA about actual net profits/expenses/growth curves from that stat. None. Zip. Zero. They could be losing money because they want to pay their employees an above market wage, or ISP's could be shafting them driving up their overhead. Don't make assumptions about Riots finances that we can't know, especially when it really is a FREE game at heart and a company by definition exists to make money. That's life.

You make it sound like you would rather pay a subscription for Lol instead because somehow bundling cosmetics "screws over" the players. This, in my opinion, is nuts.

You are right, I have absolutely no idea about Riot's expenditure, so all I do is making assumptions based on the information I have. Considering Riot would never release such information, it is the best I can do. But how is saying "they need the money to keep the game going" any different? It is also just an assumption.
Another assumption incoming: Digital Extreme also develops a F2P game called Warframe. Compared to LoL, ALL of their content can actually be obtained for free in a fairly reasonable way. On top of that they produce a buttload more content than Riot does, while likely making less money. And they are still doing fine.
